connector.description: Exchange data with external Websocket servers using Async Http Client.

camel.sink.path.httpUri.name: camel.sink.path.httpUri
camel.sink.path.httpUri.description: The URI to use such as http://hostname:port/path

camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint.description: If the option is true, then the Exchange.HTTP_URI header is ignored, and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the AhcProducer send all the fault response back.

camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize
camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.description: The initial in-memory buffer size used when transferring data between Camel and AHC Client.

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.name: camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFailure
camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.description: Option to disable throwing the AhcOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transferException
camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side, and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type (for example using Jetty or Servlet Camel components). On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is, instead of the AhcOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionClose.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionClose
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionClose.description: Define if the Connection Close header has to be added to HTTP Request. This parameter is false by default

camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.description: Configure a cookie handler to maintain a HTTP session

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming
camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming.description: To enable streaming to send data as multiple text fragments.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.binding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.binding
camel.sink.endpoint.binding.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfig.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfig
camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfig.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigOptions.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigOptions
camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigOptions.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig using the key/values from the Map.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigRealmOpt.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigRealmOptions
camel.sink.endpoint.clientConfigRealmOpt.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig Realm using the key/values from the Map.

camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. This reference overrides any configured SSLContextParameters at the component level. See Using the JSSE Configuration Utility. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

camel.component.ahc-wss.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.ahc-wss.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.ahc-wss.allowJavaSeriali.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.allowJavaSerializedObject
camel.component.ahc-wss.allowJavaSeriali.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

camel.component.ahc-wss.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.ahc-wss.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.ahc-wss.binding.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.binding
camel.component.ahc-wss.binding.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

camel.component.ahc-wss.clientConfig.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.clientConfig
camel.component.ahc-wss.clientConfig.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

camel.component.ahc-wss.headerFilterStra.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.ahc-wss.headerFilterStra.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.ahc-wss.sslContextParame.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.sslContextParameters
camel.component.ahc-wss.sslContextParame.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

camel.component.ahc-wss.useGlobalSslCont.name: camel.component.ahc-wss.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.ahc-wss.useGlobalSslCont.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
